column4: How do I know if my motherboard has s.m.a.r.t.? so I know if I should install smartmontools.
Any modern SATA drive should have SMART support
Ya, I'd just try it - that's easiest.
looks like it has SATA ports as well as IDE ports. I'd just go ahead install smartmontools and tryit out.
the tests take time to complete. try sudo smartctl -a /dev/sda
SMART isn't really a motherboard or BIOS related thing, it's the drives
reading smart responses is always somewhat of an art.
It did an extended test without error so I wouldn't be inclined to worry too much. maybe it found a bad block and remapped it, which is fairly normal
keep in mind that the drive could fail at any time, even if SMART is reporting okay. that's what backups are for.
that drive has a surprisingly low power_on_hours for a 320 GB PATA drive - did you just get it recently?
I'd be as confident in the drive as any - some SMART errors can safely be ignored
they've always had back blocks, what you have to worry about is when they start getting lots of them and when they get more than they can remap around
Is it a SATA drive? It almost certainly does. To query the drive about the SMART status you want smartmontools
if it's connected and you just need to run mount, it should still work. drive letter is likely to be sdb in that case
smartctl deals with the drives, not the partitions on them
Ya - that looks normal. Keep in mind a drive can look normal with SMART and still fail at any minute.
